definition: to pit oneself against sb/to compete with sb/contest/battle/to haggle/to quibble
to compare/to dispute/compared to/(before adj.) relatively/comparatively/rather/also pr. [jiao3]
capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word
to bicker at length over a trivial matter (idiom)

sentences.english: The cause cause chalkiness clothes are not cooler is these you reflect the heat.
sentences.chinese: 白色衣服穿上去较量凉快的理由是反射热。

sentences.english: The contest becomes mainly one of feint and counterfeint.
sentences.chinese: 这场比赛变成了一场以佯攻与反佯攻为主的较量。

sentences.english: It won't by easy against a new-look Pompey reckons Rick.
sentences.chinese: 里克估计与面貌一新的庞贝较量将不会容易。

sentences.english: He wants to take on that boxing champion.
sentences.chinese: 他想和那个拳击冠军较量。

sentences.english: He was not afraid to measure  himself against a much more dangerous animal.
sentences.chinese: 他不怕同更加危险的动物较量。

sentences.english: It's Very abundance complicated to HAs the goods reinspected and tested.
sentences.chinese: 这批货测试和复验起来较量复杂。

sentences.english: "But it is a very closely fought election, in spite of what the predictions are," said Wolffe.
sentences.chinese: 尽管有这些预测，但这仍是一场激烈的较量。

sentences.english: By the side of sickness health begos sweet.
sentences.chinese: 和疾病相较量，才能识得健康的可爱。

sentences.english: The other prisoners of war have also came to the scene, boils down to watch the competition.
sentences.chinese: 其它的战俘们也纷纷来到现场，观看此次正邪较量。

sentences.english: Fulham have won eight of the 47 League games between the two sides.
sentences.chinese: 富勒姆在两队的47场联赛较量中只赢过八场。

sentences.english: Some of the women even take on their male counterparts.
sentences.chinese: 有些女性摔角手甚至还在比赛中与男性选手较量。

sentences.english: No one had ever lasted with him in a match beyond the first move.
sentences.chinese: 迄今为止无人能在较量中同他过完第一招。

sentences.english: I hold an optimistic view of events.
sentences.chinese: 我看事情角力较量商酌达观。

sentences.english: Faulty sentence poetry and Xue pan style are having a contest at present.
sentences.chinese: 目前的诗坛实际上就是病句诗与薛蟠体的较量。

sentences.english: This kind of contest is a very common literary device.
sentences.chinese: 这种较量是非常文学化的桥段。

definition: to cross swords/to have a confrontation (with sb)
to fight over/to contest/to vie over
to start a war/to make war/to battle against
victory or defeat/the outcome of a battle
